str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A coincidence, accident, chance. From a comparative of sun and kureo; concurrence, i.e. Accident.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A priest, one who offers sacrifice to a god (in Jewish and pagan religions; of Christians only met.). From hieros; a priest.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go down, come down, either from the sky or from higher land, descend. From kata and the base of basis; to descend.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

word: he passed by on the other side.
parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pass opposite, on the opposite side of the road. From anti and parerchomai; to go along opposite.
